A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is a complex\, sprawling\, even inconsistent film. And yet\, it's great\, because it's exactly what the franchise needed\, just as Rogue One was last year. It's savvy to contemporary issues and politics\, inclusive\, and most of all\, really means it when it says that you have to let the past die. The performances and action sequences are moving\, the score is great\, and the story is thorough. Best of all\, we now have no real idea what to expect in Episode IX\, which is as it should be.
